Class CommandStack

java.lang.Object
taskmanagement.application.viewmodel.commands.CommandStack
public final class CommandStack extends Object
Maintains undo and redo stacks for executed commands.

This class implements the Command design pattern infrastructure, allowing commands to be executed, undone, and redone. It provides both:

  • Pull-style status checks via canUndo() and canRedo().
  • Push-style observables for UI binding via canUndoProperty() and canRedoProperty().

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandStack

      public CommandStack()

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(Command command) throws CommandException
      Executes the given command, pushes it onto the undo stack, and clears the redo stack.
      Parameters:
      command - the command to execute (must not be null)
      Throws:
      CommandException - if execution fails

    • undo

      public void undo() throws CommandException
      Undoes the last executed command and moves it to the redo stack. Does nothing if there is no command to undo.
      Throws:
      CommandException - if undo fails

    • redo

      public void redo() throws CommandException
      Redoes the last undone command and moves it back to the undo stack. Does nothing if there is no command to redo.
      Throws:
      CommandException - if redo fails

    • canUndo

      public boolean canUndo()
      Indicates whether an undo operation is available.
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one command to undo

    • canRedo

      public boolean canRedo()
      Indicates whether a redo operation is available.
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one command to redo

    • canUndoProperty

      public Property<Boolean> canUndoProperty()
      Provides an observable property for the undo availability flag. Useful for enabling or disabling undo-related UI controls.
      Returns:
      the observable undo property

    • canRedoProperty

      public Property<Boolean> canRedoProperty()
      Provides an observable property for the redo availability flag. Useful for enabling or disabling redo-related UI controls.
      Returns:
      the observable redo property

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears both the undo and redo stacks and refreshes availability flags. Typically used when resetting the application state.

    • undoCount

      public int undoCount()
      Returns the number of commands currently available for undo.
      Returns:
      the size of the undo stack

    • redoCount

      public int redoCount()
      Returns the number of commands currently available for redo.
      Returns:
      the size of the redo stack
